tweets.text: @LucyABeaumont @EnvAgencyNW Thank you highlighting this environmental catastrophe. We are suffering so much here and it‚Äôs mind boggling how @EnvAgencyMids is allowing it to continue!#stopthestink https://t.co/wNmFhnyIso

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/neO7mzoVRf

@RedIndustries2 @WalleysQuarry are grasping at any alternative reason for the H2S emissions at the site even though the waste cells are known hotspots due to mismanagement. #stopthestink @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/ErWJSjvNPG
I hope @AaronBell4NUL really goes for it on Wednesday in the @HouseofCommons. People are suffering because of @RedIndustries2 failures and @EnvAgency's failures. https://t.co/9rTGyVYfJj
@EnvAgencyMids Says "there is fundamentally no evidence to substantiate this claim" https://t.co/Smq7hExNI7

@StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids They are trying every trick in the book to deflect blame. @RedIndustries2 have you got no shame? Admit you are criminally negligent it is your only option left.

@StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off

@SOPH_C_ So before now absolutely no loads were turned away? So it is only now operators are trying to dump loads not allowed? It seems odd people would only try now with such attention on the site. Is there an audit trail for ALL historical checks? @EnvAgency #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe
Thank you @LucyABeaumont for your wonderful support and interest. Thank you !! @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe https://t.co/jRNjS4Y0ZB
@StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids So a spot check finds 6 loads when they make the effort that 42 a week. So 2184 a year and you wonder why we suffer.
@richbeanjohnson @StinkStopthe @HelenVi00175623 @SianieRoo @Cap_it_off @EnvAgency Sorry you got it, we had rare night off, it's a dream to have every night off being poisoned for us all #stopthestink

@EnvAgencyMids @SOPH_C_ @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @ClareDinnisEA the people deserve to see proof of this apparent diligence that Red have been showing. How many other loads have been turned away then pre monitoring? #stopthestink @StinkStopthe https://t.co/Q5uKtOp8Ty
Thank you so much @LucyABeaumont for your help and support. Thank you. @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @StinkStopthe https://t.co/h91a3XeAvF

@StinkStopthe @EnvAgency And we get @EnvAgencyMids , ‚Äúer pardon me red would you mind awfully stopping the noxious gas , there‚Äôs a good fellow . ‚Ä¶.. what‚Äôs that no you won‚Äôt . urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
Important new research out today by @Jamie_Woodward_ & others identifies water firms as the main source of microplastics in UK rivers. 

Builds more pressure on government @EnvAgency to tackle the way water firms release untreated effluent into our rivers.
https://t.co/HKK1Ar0abP

urls.title: Wastewater is 'polluting rivers with microplastic'
urls.description: "Frequent releases" of sewage create microplastic hotspots in UK rivers.

tweets.text:
@PJennings88 @EnvAgency As yesterday's Manchester University research confirmed.

"To produce such high levels of [plastics] contamination, [they] must be releasing wastewater into low flows - so when there isn't heavy rain."

Who'd have guessed.

https://t.co/neO7mzoVRf

About sewage discharges for the start of the bathing water season, https://t.co/4X1CLAgkS6 about 18mins in from the start of the programme. radio 4 Today programme. We must not forget @EnvAgency this should only happen in exceptional circumstances not part of a routine.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.
